title: Supply Chain Business Analyst I, Global Logistics Supply Chain
job_description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  DescriptionAt Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. Amazon is seeking a Business Analyst to drive large scale projects, programs, and technical initiatives. In this role, you will be responsible for converting data into actionable business insights. The ideal candidate is an analysis expert who leverages a variety of data platforms and analytical tools to provide timely, meaningful, and consumable information. They build deep contextual and domain knowledge, and ensure data quality and build scalable tools. They communicate findings with the most effective and influential methods.As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting the medium to long-term planning. This role will be responsible for partnering with multiple stakeholders to forecast the business needs for the next 3 years. A critical part of this role is to develop stable models and to be able to take the stabilized models to the next level from an automation standpoint. This role requires exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with Operations, Finance, Recruiting, and HR stakeholders in a high-pressure environment. You will manage a high-visibility program and partner with all levels of leadership to exercise sound judgment where clear guidelines may not exist.Key job responsibilities Performing data analysis/modelling using 6-18 month range to analyze capacity gaps and work cross functionally with partner teams on recommendations to solve. Responsible for providing visibility to program status (issues, risks, metrics, etc.) on an ongoing basis to leadership, all stakeholders and team members. Maintain a global scope in building mechanisms and projects partnering with leaders in both US, CN and EU regions, thereby sharing best practices and standardization. Comfortable with ambiguities, conflicting priorities and multi-cultural and matrix environment. Some travel will be required for this role as partner teams are placed globally. This travel is not expected to exceed 25%.A day in the lifeThe successful candidate will partner with cross functional teams to develop and analyze long term (6-18 month horizon) solutions for all Global Logistics operations which include, Amazon Managed Imports and Domestic transportation and Warehouse Transfers.The candidate will think holistically about input planning collection and output supply chain solutions to provide recommendations/modeling on long term capabilities. The leader will drive reduction in supply chain costs, while improving lead time and reliability. This person will help develop the analytics needed to build out plans and work with partner teams to drive network goals and a cohesive customer focused based execution strategy.Strong candidates will have a background in Global logistics and fulfillment operations along with data modelling and technology solutions that can navigate the shifting requirements of a complex supply chain network to deliver results.This role requires the Business Analyst to collaborate with multiple cross functional stakeholders (both internal and external) on aligning strategy that provides significant business impact. This person should show good judgement and foster a constructive dialogue, harmonize discordant views and build consensus across multiple teams independently.The candidate should be able to communicate ideas effectively, verbally and in writing. The successful candidate will be able to retrieve and analyze data using Excel, Quicksight, SQL or other data management systems.Amazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full-time employees include: Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage Maternity and Parental Leave Options Paid Time Off (PTO) 401(k) PlanAbout The TeamThe Inbound Transportation Mid-Range Planning team is responsible for all mid-range (QXG/OPX) plans for the Amazon Global Logistics (AGL) organization. This includes Direct Imports (DI), FBA Imports, WePay, Partner Carrier Program (PCP), and Warehouse Transfers (WHT). We work across partner teams to develop plan inputs, validate entitlements, and drive overall improvements within each planning cycle. We drive the business by identifying areas of risk and opportunity within the plans and partnering across teams to develop roadmaps to increase profitability.We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:Atlanta, GA, USA | Bellevue, WA, USA | Tempe, AZ, USABasic Qualifications Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, operations, engineering, analytics or related field 2+ years of Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables) experience Experience in financial/business analysis Experience with SQL or ETL Experience using data and metrics to determine and drive improvements 2+ years of relevant professional experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis 2+ years of experience with Supply Chain Management concepts, e.g., forecasting, planning, optimization, and logisticsPreferred Qualifications MBA and work experience in a technical field is highly desired 2+years of experienced developing requirements and creating requirements documents and process flows Ability to organize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously Working knowledge of LEAN and SIX SIGMA methodologies and familiarity with Oracle business intelligence tools is a plus Intermediate to advanced knowledge of SQL, Perl, Unix/Linux, Visual Basic or other programming languages are a plus Excellent written and verbal communication skills complemented with the ability to problem solve independently If you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skillsets. If you're passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. DescriptionAmazon Web Services (AWS), a subsidiary of Amazon.com and a leader in cloud computing, is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Strategic Planning and Operations Analyst to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between business stakeholders and technical teams, including data engineers, analysts, and data scientists. The primary responsibility will be to communicate business requirements effectively to ensure data-driven solutions aligned with the organization's strategic objectives. The talented individual contributor will work closely with strategic planning leaders, analytics and finance teams on projects aimed to advance the prioritization of strategic priorities, prove the measured value of potential and current initiatives. title: SAP BUSINESS ANALYST OTC
job_description: DescriptionTrident Seafoods is the largest vertically integrated seafood harvesting and processing company in North America. Trident is a privately held, 100 percent USA-owned company with primary seafood processing operations and fleet support in twelve Alaska communities. Trident’s global operations produce finished wild Alaska seafood products in 6 countries and its sales teams serve customers in over 50 countries. Trident employs approximately 9,000 people worldwide each year and partners with over 5,400 independent fishermen and crewmembers. Species harvested and processed by Trident include virtually every commercial species of salmon, whitefish, and crab harvested in the North Pacific and Alaska. The global supply chain also includes cultured and wild species from a network of trusted sources worldwide.Follow Trident on the Web at www.tridentseafoods.com or on social media on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, YouTube or LinkedInSummary:The OTC IT BA will serve as SME providing guidance to internal business teams on best practices in adopting S/4 HANA out-of-the-box solutions in SAP Sales Distribution (SD) and related modules. This position will work very closely with the system integrator and will be a main point of contact for the OTC business users.Key Responsibilities:Master the end-to-end OTC process and develop expertise across SAP SD and different apps.Validates proposed solutions from system integrator.Reviews and drives configuration and testing outcomes with the system integrator teams.Participates in relevant workshops with system integrators and drive standardization of business processes, leveraging out-of-the-box solutions in SAP for OTC processes. Provides guidance to internal teams on best practices in adopting S/4 HANA out-of-the-box solutions in SAP SD and related modules, with a goal to reduce custom RICEFW.Participates in design decisions on integration with non-SAP systems.Configures SAP SD and related modules; develop scenarios and test to ensure compliance with Trident requirements.Provides expertise in identifying the relevant master and transactional data required for data cleansing and data extraction for migrations in SAP SD.Serves as key advisor to business and IT for hands-on usage of S/4 HANA functionality.Additional Responsibilities: Provides training to internal teams on specific areas in SAP SD and related modules, as needed.Keeps pace with the evolving S/4 HANA roadmap, research and run internal Proof of Concept sessions, as needed, for better features and better alternatives in S/4 HANA to address business requirements.Runs internal Proof of Concept sessions, as needed, for better features and better alternatives in Acquires knowledge of Trident’s Environmental and Safety Policies by completing required training programs and performing designated work activities in accordance with training and procedures/work instructions Notifies designated personnel of any environmental or safety incidents or risks not previously documented, in accordance with Environmental Awareness and/or safety trainings.This is a salaried exempt position with an annualized salary range of $120k to $150k.Trident Seafoods offers a comprehensive and quality benefits package. Full time employees may be eligible for discretionary/performance-based incentives, medical, dental and vision insurance plans, optional HRA/HSA, telemedicine, employee assistance and wellness programs, long-term disability, basic life and AD&D, and 401(k) with a company match, vacation, sick time, 10 paid holidays each year, and paid parental leave. For full-time employees, the initial vacation benefit starts at 10 days per year, adjusted commensurate with relevant experience, and 7 days of sick leave per year (9 in Seattle), accrued bi-weekly. Commuter and transit programs are also available.Minimum RequirementsMinimum Qualifications:A minimum of 5 years of experience in SAP modules, reflecting increasing levels of responsibility.A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business, or related fieldExperience in multiple end-to-end full life cycle SAP implementation projects and at least one end-to-end full life cycle SAP implementation of SAP S/4 HANA.Hands-on experience in configuring SAP SD and related modules.Demonstrated understanding and application of the functional aspects of the analysis and design process and its associated documentation, including functional specifications and test plans.Preferred Qualifications:Demonstrated experience with industry best practices and implementing SAP business processes.Implementation experience in S/4 HANA in the manufacturing Food and Beverage Industry.Apply Now
Industries: Food and Beverage Services, Food and Beverage Manufacturing, and Fisheries

title: Business Analyst V
job_description: Job Title: Business Analyst V Duration: 11 months Location: Seattle, WA 98101 Job Type: Contract Work Type: Remote OverviewTekWissen Group is a workforce management provider throughout the USA and many other countries in the world. Our client is a company operating a marketplace for consumers, sellers, and content creators. It offers merchandise and content purchased for resale from vendors and those offered by thirdparty sellers.Job DescriptionThe Audience and Cross-Channel Strategy team (AXM) is part of Client’s Global Brand and Fixed Marketing (GBFM), and is in charge of strengthening our audience-first, data-driven and outcome-based approach across advertising and marketing campaigns. We’re looking for an Audience Data Strategy Lead to be the bridge between applied data scientists within our measurement and media planning team (MODE) and the Sr. Marketing Managers leading Audience and Cross-Channel Media Strategy for each of our business priorities within our Integrated Marketing Communications team. This person will focus on working with data scientists and proprietary tools to provide data- informed insights and solutions that guide development and execution of addressable audience strategy by bringing in sophisticated science and advanced analytics. You’ll enjoy this role if you’re both a big picture thinker and can enjoy a data deep dive, a strong communicator (both written and verbal), have an entrepreneurial spirit and the ability to influence others. This role sits at the intersection of data and strategy, and requires very strong right brain/left orientation with seasoned judgment. To be successful, you will need to understand how to scope the business challenge and lead strategic thinking to build a learning agenda, and collaborate with scientists to build out the data on which you can deliver actionable insights and recommendations. This person needs to be an expert in big data and advanced statistics, and a critical thinker with the hunger to identify and solve brand’s business challenges through data. This role will lead audience experimentation and developing hypotheses around key strategies and insights, and you will manage ambiguity and competing priorities while staying focused on short-term and long-term goals. The ideal candidate is highly collaborative, but self-driven with strong bias for action and an ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete data. They will be a strong technical thinker focused on business intelligence with strategy ex pertise and a working knowledge of or experience in cross-channel media planning (including TV, CTV/POLV, Digital (OLV & Display), Social, OOH, Radio, etc.). This role requires an entrepreneur mentality to help develop and enhance audience and data products and services as well as analytic processes and innovations for advanced audience analytics. You will be resourceful and find creative solutions to complex technical and business Challenges. Story Behind The Need – Business Group & Key ProjectsWhat is the purpose of your team /who is your team made up of/what is the team culture like?  The Audience Strategy & Cross Channel Media team is responsible for developing meaningful audience segments with actionable behavioral, demographic and psychographic insights to drive improved effectiveness and incremental efficiency performance against the Trifecta measurement model across marketing channels and campaigns. This includes identifying key campaign characteristics by audience such as reach, frequency, customer behavior and KPI goals. The team consists of two primary functions, Strategists and Analysts. The AXM Strategists are organized by business line and are the owners of audience and media strategy within the IMC process. They are responsible for designing measurable cross-media strategies built with an audience-first foundation across premium video (TV/POLV/Cinema), digital (OLV, audio, display, social) and offline (radio, OOH, experiential, etc.) that can influence creative development to reach audiences in the most resonate way on the channels where they spend the most time. The AXM Analysts identify insights and opportunities across customer lifecycle and 3P data to inform segmentation strategies. They are responsible for collaborating with the data science team to build the intricate data infrastructure and will lead analysis of the commonalities and differences of our audience universes to build measurably effect segments. They will also be key collaborators with the product teams as we build the tools and expertise to operationalize our audience insights and analytics functions. The team is highly collaborative and supportive. We work hard, but there is flexibility and autonomy in driving great work. What is the purpose of this role specifically?  Are there key projects this contractor will be helping accomplish? This person will be helping build out the insights and analysis infrastructure for our audience science engine. They will be collaborating with strategists and scientist to help define what audience analytics looks like at Client. Typical Day In The RoleWhat does a typical day in this position look like? (percentage breakdown of work they will be doing) Collaborate with Head of Audience Strategy to operationalize our new audience-driven approach to advertising and marketing Work closely with Audience & Cross-Channel Media Strategy leads to develop audience learning agenda to conduct methodical approach in business and audience analyses via modeling and analytic efforts to provide insights and outputs that can help guide audience identification and activation Leverage 1P and 3P proprietary data assets to generate insights through descriptive and exploratory statistics to help identify the highest value audiences for the brand/campaign based on the business drivers and KPIs Work with the MODE team to build measurement framework and KPIs to ensure the in-depth performance insights are delivered in a closed loop audience measurement solution that combines data/audiences, media exposures and conversions Gather and analyze statistical data using modern and traditional methods to formulate reports and make recommendations. Devise and evaluate methods for collecting data (Surveys, Questionnaires, Opinion Polls) Collaborate with Audience Strategists and MODE team to assess performance data and bring optimization and interpretation thoughts and recommendations Guide the science team in database querying and data mining with the understanding of the connections across datasets Script writing for insight generation automation (i.e., audience profile generation)  Develop trusted advisor relationships with internal teams and bring education and consultancy on how people-based data can be leveraged across the planning, activation and measurement Assist in pioneering new approaches and work to best frame the use of data in all use cases from understanding and helping activating omni-channel addressable strategies, guiding dynamic creative strategies, etc. Remain fully informed on market trends, other parties researches and implement best practices How much interaction will this person have with the surrounding team? Is it collaborative or mostly independent work? A combination of independent and collaborative. Will be working cross-functionality with peer and senior level stakeholders in strategy and science, but will need to be able to work independently to solve problems and analyze data. Compelling Story & Candidate Value PropositionWhat makes this position stand out/unique selling points? Highly collaborative team that drives high visibility work for Client’s top LOBs. Strong budget to match objectives. Ability to build out a new functionality on the team. What would an individual gain from accepting this role over another they may be offered? Experience at a top brand like Client, within a team that is focused on some of leadership’s top 2023 priorities. Candidate RequirementsAre there any Client Leadership principles you feel best align to this role? Earns Trust, Bias for Action Does this contractor need to hold any specific degrees or certifications? Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent work experience 8-10+ years’ relevant experience A solid understanding of the role of data in media planning, activation and measurement  Advanced ability to draw insights from analysis supported by data and clearly communicate them to the stakeholders and senior management as required Deep knowledge of data warehousing, as well as Big and basic data mining routines Intellectual curiosity and solid understanding in data sources and ecosystems with the ability to see from the brand’s business lens  Proven experience in developing meaningful data-driven insights and advanced media analytics Knowledge and understanding in ad tech landscape and biddable media ecosystem (across search, social, or programmatic) Experience or/and knowledge in digital marketing technologies, including DSP, DMP, Ad Server, Ad Verification, Site Analytics and audience syndication and measurement tools is a plus Proven success in collaborating across multiple teams, handling multiple high priority projects in a fast-paced setting Ability to work on a diverse team or with a diverse range of coworkers Client is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. What are must have qualities/skillsets you are looking for? SQL/Python/R knowledge a must Advanced Statistics a plus Adequate knowledge of data collection methods (polls, focus groups, surveys etc)  Strong analytical and critical thinking Crosstab/statistical analysis tools (SPSS, Q, Telmar, etc) is a plus  Do you have any “nice to have” but not must haves you would like to include? Agency experience in media and audience segmentation Does your team have specific metrics/performance indicators to the contractor so that they know they are doing well in their job? Ability to bridget the gap between strategy and science, Timely development of deliverables, peer review on level of collaboration and strategic thinking Top 3 Must-have Hard SkillsAudience analytics Customer behavior analytics & strategy Understanding of media landscape TekWissen® Group is an equal opportunity/affirmative action Employer (m/f/d/v) supporting workforce diversity.

title: WM Solutions Sr. Business Analyst
job_description: Summary/Function:In this dynamic and highly visible role, the WM Solutions Sr. Business Analyst reports directly to the e WM Chief Operating Officer and is responsible for addressing emergent and tactical Wealth Management issues, projects and initiatives as assigned. Duties range from solving and remediating day-to-day business matters, drafting presentations and communications, and standing ready to represent the COO in key meetings. Additionally, the WM Solutions Sr. Business Analyst supports important projects by running business analysis meetings with agendas meant to drive decision-making, taking initiative on action items, and when necessary, supporting all members of the Wealth Management leadership team.The WM Solutions Sr. Business Analyst requires a high level of energy and drive to learn all aspects of the Wealth Management business and excel in all assigned areas. Additionally, the role necessitates the ability to problem solve, manage multiple changing priorities and tasks, and effectively and respectfully navigate obstacles as they arise. This role requires working from the Seattle office location. Qualifications:• Bachelor’s degree, preferably in finance, economics, business, communication, or a related field• 3+ years’ experience in securities industry• Series 7/66 licenses preferred• Demonstrated project management experience or training a plus with the ability to drive projects to completion• Strong technology skills, including proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint• Ability to work M-F from Seattle office locationKey Skills and Competencies:• Highly motivated and resourceful self-starter• Superior written and verbal communication skills• Superior judgement, attention to detail, accuracy, and consistency• Ability to think and work independently, multi-task, prioritize, and follow through on assigned work• Ability to handle confidential information and matters with discretion. Duties:• Provide ad hoc daily support to the COO, to include: • Respond to tactical and urgent Financial Advisor and Associate needs as directed; work with Regional Directors, legal, compliance, operations, supervision, IT, and others in leadership to troubleshoot, identify and implement solutions.• Support timely problem solving and remediation when issues are identified.• Track ongoing issues and feedback from the field and other stakeholders and determine the appropriate project, prioritization and path to resolution.• Participate in various meetings as a delegate of COO; document takeaways and follow-up on assigned action items. • Provide daily status-updates to COO on relevant items.Provide business analysis and project support, to include: • Address a variety of requests made to Wealth Management leadership, including analysis of project impacts and dependencies, project scoping, project planning, requirement gathering, and implementation of changes based on business priorities and decisions.• Complete other special projects as assigned. Provide meeting, presentation, and communication support for the COO, to include:• Assist with meeting planning, preparation, and tracking of follow-up items for senior-level recurring meetings, to include Risk Management Committee, Wealth Management Committee, Financial Advisory Council, Branch Manager Advisory Council, and Technology Advisory Council. Planning and preparation to include conducting business analysis and data to drive decisions. • Assist with preparation of presentations for events such as the Branch Manager Meeting, Davidson Institute, Reward Clubs, and Advisory Councils. Planning and preparation to include gathering, understanding and being able to reiterate key business decisions and practices that impact Wealth Management Business. • Draft and edit important internal and client-centric communications.• Provide vendor management & business continuity support, to include: • Handle select vendor relationships for Wealth Management, to include managing invoice payments, facilitating contract reviews, annual vendor assessments, and other general vendor management issues.Other:• Stay informed about regulatory requirements, best practices, and industry trends, ensuring that they are considered as part of business analysis and decisions, and that Wealth Management adheres to relevant compliance standards. What we offer:Competitive salary plus excellent benefits and perks including, but not limited to: • Medical, Dental and Vision• Company 401(k)and ESOP contribution • Generous sick, vacation, and maternity/parental leave• Paid holidays• Professional Development Opportunities• Tuition Reimbursement ($15,000 lifetime cap)• Charitable gift-matching program• Davidson Day of Giving – Our tradition of positively impacting communities in which we live and work. The potential pay range for this role is $75,000 - $100,000. The compensation offered will be determined on a case-by-case basis considering a variety of factors including, but not limited to, the skills, relevant work experience, and geographic location of each specific candidate. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Sr Business Analyst, Compliance Ops, Amazon Health Services
job_description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  DescriptionAmazon Health Services (AHS) is looking for a Sr Business Analyst to help drive Healthcare Compliance's Data Analytics strategy across the organization.As part of the Compliance Operations team, our overall strategy is to centralize and scale our program across AHS. The team's focus is to standardize strategies for risk mitigation, minimize process redundancies, and optimize resources for a robust compliance program.Come join us on our journey to make it drastically easier for customers to find, choose, afford, and engage with the services, products, and professionals they need to get and stay healthy!Key job responsibilitiesThe AHS Compliance Sr Business Analyst supports the collection and interpretation of insightful data analytics across the organization. You will do so through with the support of senior management by managing metrics reporting and performing big data analysis to provide strategic advice on business operational performance.You will collect business use cases, research and evaluate opportunities to help Amazon Health Services leverage its data to support business functions through mathematical modeling.You will utilize database technologies (e.g.SQL) to design, develop, and evaluate highly innovative business intelligence tools and automated reports for Compliance targeting and optimization.In essence, you transform complicated business problems into data-driven solutions, identifying opportunities to improve our existing operation, driving process improvement projects and developing dashboards and real-time analytics to inform decision-making in our growing Compliance operations network.A day in the lifeDesigning and building analytics tools for our growing and evolving Health space.Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.Measuring and triggering proactive audits and financial impact of our operationsPartnering with our Compliance operations, Billing Compliance, Monitoring, Data Engineering and Product teams to identify new workflow automation opportunities through observation and analysisSupporting software product decisions with quantified ROI analyses for feature development and prioritization to address improvement opportunitiesSupporting cross-functional teams on the day-to-day execution of the existent program implementationAbout The TeamHealthcare is a highly regulated industry and compliance impacts all teams and business operations. The AHS Compliance team has the unique ability to see broadly across the org and make a significant impact to ensure compliance measures are implemented and communicated timely to all impacted stakeholders. You will be joining a motivated group with a startup mentality that is eager to expand our business and improve the healthcare experience for our customers.We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:Seattle, WA, USABasic Qualifications 5+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience 3+ years of writing SQL queries and creating business intelligence reports using Tableau, Power BI experience Bachelor's degree Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights Experience with Excel Experience with SQL Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholdersPreferred Qualifications MBAAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $94,600/year in our lowest geographic market up to $185,000/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: Business Analyst - People Advisory Services - Performance - Manager - Multiple Positions - 1495190
job_description: EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities. At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.Business Analyst, People Advisory Services, Performance (Manager) (Multiple Positions) (1495190), Ernst & Young U.S. LLP, Seattle, WA. Enable business change in areas including Enterprise Transformation and Risk Management, Finance Transformation, Enterprise Resource Planning, Supply Chain and Customer transformation by assisting clients in successfully managing and sustaining people, process and/or technology change by focusing on business engagement, readiness and adoption. Vision/translate the business case into a compelling case for change. Plan study of work problems and procedures around organizational change. Document findings of study and prepare recommendations for implementation of new systems, procedures, and organizational changes. Gather and organize information on problems or procedures. Analyze data, develop solutions and present conclusions. Achieve sponsor and leadership alignment that elevates their skills as drivers of change and stakeholder management that is engaged and inclusive. Create targeted and interactive communications. Design an organization alignment that links processes, governance, structure and culture with the future. Develop workforce strategy and talent development plans that minimize disruption and equips people with skills for new roles.Manage and motivate teams with diverse skills and backgrounds. Consistently deliver quality client services by monitoring progress. Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge. Maintain long-term client relationships and networks. Cultivate business development opportunities.Full time employment, Monday – Friday, 40 hours per week, 8:30 am – 5:30 pm.MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:Must have a Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Human Resources, MIS (business perspective), Political Science, Psychology, Statistics, or related field and 5 years of progressive, post-baccalaureate related work experience. Alternatively, will accept a Master’s degree in Business, Economics, Human Resources, MIS (business perspective), Political Science, Psychology, Statistics, or related field and 4 years of related work experience.Must have 4 years of experience in combination in providing people and organizational change advisory services in large-scale, end to end transformations for Finance, Supply Chain and Customer, IT, HR and/or Risk transformation strategic initiatives, including at least 6 of the following: Visioning and Strategy workshop design and delivery, Leadership Alignment and Development, Stakeholder Management, Communications, Operating Model and Organizational Design, Governance, Training, Competency Assessment, Talent Management and Culture Change.Must have 2 years of experience in transformation management for large scale business transformation projects and programs.Must have 2 years of experience managing a team of junior consulting professionals.Travel required up to 80%, of which 10% may be international.Employer will accept any suitable combination of education, training, or experience.Please apply on-line at ey.com/en_us/careers and click on "Careers - Job Search”, then “Search Jobs" (Job Number - 1495190).What We OfferWe offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The base salary for this job is $151,630.00 per year. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.EY | Building a better working worldEY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law.EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities including veterans with disabilities. If you have a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during any part of the application process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, type Option 2 (HR-related inquiries) and then type Option 1 (HR Shared Services Center), which will route you to EY’s Talent Shared Services Team or email SSC Customer Support at ssc.customersupport@ey.comThis particular position at Ernst & Young in the United States requires the qualified candidate to be a "United States worker" as defined by the U.S. Department of Labor regulations at 20 CFR 656.3. You can review this definition at https://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/pkg/CFR-2011-title20-vol3/pdf/CFR-2011-title20-vol3-sec656-3.pdf at the bottom of page 750. Please feel free to apply to other positions that do not require you to be a "U.S. worker".

title: LEAN Business Process Analyst (Mid-Level) - Naval Shipyard (NAVSEA 04X) Program Support
job_description: Responsibilities Noblis MSD’s mission is to support the Naval Sea Systems Command (NAVSEA) objectives to design, build, deliver and maintain ships, submarines, and systems reliably, on-time and on-cost for the Navy. We are looking to hire a LEAN Business Process Analyst (Mid-Level) for scientific, engineering, technical, and analytical (SETA) support to NAVSEA 04X and the Naval Shipyards.The LEAN Business Process Analyst (Mid-Level) Will Be Responsible For Improving Upon Existing Processes And Systems To Achieve Improved Maintenance Execution At The Naval Shipyards. The Successful Candidate Will Focus On Shipyard And Project Team Performance, Including Business Policy, Process, And Strategy Implementation. The LEAN Business Process Analyst (Mid-Level) Will Contribute To Extensive Investigations To Understand Root Cause Of Issues Across Functions And Business Elements Of Shipyard And Project Team Operations While Providing Other Direct Support To The Noblis LEAN Project Operations Manager In The Execution Of The Following LEAN Program Objectives: Planning, training, coaching, facilitating LEAN events, metric development, solution implementation, sustainment, and integration functions or activities as necessary to successfully achieve process/performance improvement objectives  Initiative Identification and scoping of potential shipyard business improvement opportunities  Provide BCAs with particular focus on throughput, cycle time of shipyard business and industrial processes  Implementation of strategy and plans, including management of education and training support and initiatives  Required Qualifications Bachelors degree in a related filed. Additional relevant experience may be considered in lieu of a Bachelors AND m inimum 5 years minimum experience supporting or leading process improvement initiatives, including LEAN practitioner certification (e.g. ASQ certified Black Belt). DOD SECRET Security Clearance  Skilled in use of MS Office Suite tools and applications  Drafting and delivering presentations (to junior and senior personnel), including facilitation for small and large groups  Appropriate written and verbal communication skills to interact with U.S. Navy military and civilian personnel #seao4x Desired Qualifications  Broad naval maintenance and/or Naval Shipyards (or related field)  Familiarity with public naval shipyards operational/management structure and strategic initiatives, CNO availability planning and execution (CONUS and OCONUS), NAVSEA strategic initiatives and insertion into naval shipyards.  Overview Noblis and our wholly owned subsidiaries, Noblis ESI , and Noblis MSD tackle the nation's toughest problems and apply advanced solutions to our clients' most critical missions. We bring the best of scientific thought, management, and engineering expertise together in an environment of independence and objectivity to deliver enduring impact on federal missions. Noblis works with a wide range of government clients in the defense, intelligence and federal civil sectors. Learn more at Noblis -About Us Why work at a Noblis company? Our employees find greater meaning in their work and balance the other things in life that matter to them. Our people are our greatest asset. They are exceptionally skilled, knowledgeable, team-oriented, and mission-driven individuals who want to do work that matters and benefits the public. Noblis has won numerous workplace awards . Noblis maintains a drug-free workplace. Salary Range Explanation  At Noblis we recognize and reward your contributions, provide you with growth opportunities, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, and work-life programs. Our award programs acknowledge employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our service standards. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in our benefit programs. title: Manager Business Analytics, Seller Trust
job_description: DescriptionAs we strive to be Earth's most customer-centric company, Amazon has reinvented how hundreds of millions of people shop online – providing customers with the opportunity to find and discover virtually anything they want to buy and providing millions of sellers with a platform for growing successful businesses. We are looking for an exceptional business analyst to help us develop new ways to build trust and loyalty with sellers, a crucial component of our flywheelSellers’ trust in Amazon is our top priority and in this role, you will be tasked with building that trust over time by diving deep into how we measure our progress and helping to identify and prioritize key areas of focus. Amazon’s growth requires leaders who move fast, have an entrepreneurial spirit to create new solutions, have an unrelenting tenacity to get things done, and are capable of breaking down and solving complex problems.The successful candidate will be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity and be able to create and maintain efficient & automated processes. They will set the vision, strategy, and roadmap, and work alongside with stakeholders in the organization to make it happen. They know and love working with business intelligence tools, can model multidimensional datasets, and can partner effectively with business leaders to answer key business questions. They are analytical and creative, and don’t quit. This is a role with high visibility to senior leadership and with high opportunity for impact for those willing to roll up their sleeves and dive deep to achieve results.Key job responsibilities Manage and develop a team of Business Analysts. Lead a team to create actionable insights to answer business questions, drive decisions, and develop recommendations to improve operations. Define and drive our business intelligence and visualization strategy and roadmap. Present analysis and recommendations to senior leaders, using data-driven storytelling and influence to drive improvements in business operations and strategic change. Collaborate with product management, program management, and data science to design and develop information management capabilities. Lead the creation of key business metrics, drive the vision and building of automated dashboards and self-service analytic capabilities, and engineer data-driven processes that drive business value. Own the design, development, maintenance, and automation of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions. Adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation. Collaborate and partner with stakeholders to understand, anticipate, and respond to current and future information needs.We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:Seattle, WA, USABasic Qualifications 7+ years of business intelligence and analytics experience 5+ years of delivering results managing a business intelligence or analytics team, including employee development and performance management experience Experience with SQL and ETL Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar toolsPreferred Qualifications Experience collaborating and writing requirements/user stories for engineering teamsAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $114,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $212,600/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.Company - Amazon.com Services LLCJob ID: A2610993

title: Finance & Strategy Analyst
job_description: Who we areAbout StripeStripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.About The TeamThe Finance & Strategy team is an integral thought partner to Stripe’s core functional leaders. We bring understanding and predictability to Stripe’s bottom line financials. We work cross functionally across many surfaces at Stripe and help steward Stripe’s resource investments to improve the durability of our long term financial performance.What you’ll doWe're looking for a F&S Analyst to join our growing team. This individual will help us with the forecasting budgeting and reporting for various departments accurately and in a timely manner and deliver improvements in our integrated financial systems with business partners, financial colleagues, and engineers.ResponsibilitiesLeverage your financial background to support and influence key strategic and business decisionsDesign and provide analytical rigor to measure efficiency and ROI of investments in headcount and non-headcount expensesDrive reporting, process and discipline for finance routines to shape and influence decision-making (e.g. budget, forecast, monthly reviews, long-range plans)Build and own models for in-depth analyses, as well as ensure their quality, timeliness, and accuracyDefine metrics and leading indicators of business performancePartner with cross functional teams, such as Data Science, to develop reporting dashboardsDrive continuous process improvement, standardization, simplification and reporting enhancements.Who you areWe're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.Minimum Requirements3-5 years of relevant experience in strategic finance or FP&A A keen analytical eye and experience building integrated models from scratch (in Excel, or other planning applications)Experience driving and executing on finance processes (e.g. budget, forecast reviews, negotiations)A proven ability to build strong collaborative working relationships with business partnersA proven ability to be a self starter capable of driving business results without significant supervisionThe ability to maintain high performance under tight timelines and a “roll up your sleeves” mindset to get any job doneThe ability to bring structure to ambiguous areas of opportunity and thrive in an unstructured, fast-moving environmentExcellent communication and organizational skills, both written and verbal.Excellent problem-solving skills and demonstrated ability to work independently, analyze problems and data sets to make complex investigation decisionsStrong knowledge of GSuite tools, Salesforce and MS-Office products and experience working with/analyzing contracts and large data sets using SQL.Independently analyze and evaluate information from various data sources to determine a course of action for a matched caseDemonstrated experience partnering with cross-functional stakeholdersDemonstrated history of taking on various types of challenging projects and producing resultsSolution-oriented mindset with enthusiasm for establishing best practicesSelf-disciplined, diligent, proactive and detail orientedYou Will Also Likely Have (not Required)Experience working at a high-growth technology or financial services companyExperience managing headcount and operating expensesExperience supporting Go-to-Market and/or Product FunctionsOracle, Anaplan, Tableau or other equivalent application experienceExperience with Python or a willingness to learnExperience in data visualization and dashboardingHybrid work at StripeOffice-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.Pay and benefitsThe annual US base salary range for this role is $122,400 - $183,600. For sales roles, the range provided is the role’s On Target Earnings ("OTE") range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate’s experience, qualifications, and location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the US may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.Additional benefits for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; 401(k) plan; medical, dental, and vision benefits; and wellness stipends.

title: Senior Business Analyst, Transportation Financial Systems
job_description: DescriptionTransportation Financial Systems (TFS) is one of the largest technological components within the transportation organization enabling the corporation to conduct global trade. These systems are a cornerstone to the success of all global program launches including retail expansions into new geographies and the establishment of new transportation arcs. TFS provides an end-to-end financial solution for all financial transactions including tax integration, financial document creation & management, expense auditing, accounting, payments, and cost allocation functions. We leverage the latest machine learning technologies to develop highly scalable next generation products driving real time financial accounting, reporting, and business insights.The role will support the development of a best in class financial system enabling the sustainable growth of the Amazon Transportation Network. We are looking for analytical, technically skilled, innovative, hands-on, and customer-obsessed Business Analyst to join our fast-paced dynamic team. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, relishes working with large volumes of data, enjoys the challenge of highly complex business contexts, and, above all else, is a passionate about data and analytics. This role will be pivotal in supporting our product, business, and tech team to meet their challenging goals by providing targeted and actionable insight.Transportation Financial Systems (TFS) is the largest financial technological component within the organization, enabling global trade. These systems are pivotal to the success of all service offerings, and program launches, including retail expansions into new regions and the establishment of new transportation arcs. TFS offers a comprehensive financial solution for all transactions, incorporating tax integration, financial document creation & management, expense auditing, accounting, payments, and cost allocation functions. We utilize the latest machine learning technologies to create highly scalable, next-gen products that drive real-time financial accounting, reporting, and business insights.This role will aid in the development of industry-leading financial system that supports the sustainable growth of the Amazon Transportation Network. We are seeking an analytical, technically proficient, innovative, hands-on, and customer-focused Business Analyst to join our dynamic, fast-paced team. The ideal candidate excels in a high-speed environment, enjoys working with large amounts of data, welcomes the challenge of highly complex business contexts, and is passionate about data and analytics. This role will play a critical part in helping our product, business, and tech team achieve their challenging objectives by providing focused and actionable insights.Key job responsibilities compile queries for report generation in QuickSight, Tableau, and Excel Deliver key metrics, reports, and performance indicators, and solve ambiguous analyses and identify root causes Design and implement analytical models using statistical analysis Translate complex or ambiguous business problems into analysis requirements Understand the data required by the wider business for complex or comparative analysis Design, develop and deliver scalable tools for seamless data exploration and analytics for our internal stakeholders and understand customer interactions, improve the customer experience, and meet our goals Effectively communicate complex analytical insights and business implicationWe are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:Bellevue, WA, title: LEAN Business Process Analyst (Senior) - Naval Shipyard (NAVSEA 04X) Program Support
job_description: Responsibilities Noblis MSD’s mission is to support the Naval Sea Systems Command (NAVSEA) objectives to design, build, deliver and maintain ships, submarines, and systems reliably, on-time and on-cost for the Navy. We are looking to hire a LEAN Business Process Analyst (Senior) for scientific, engineering, technical, and analytical (SETA) support to NAVSEA 04X and the Naval Shipyards.The LEAN Business Process Analyst (Senior) Will Be Responsible For Improving Upon Existing Processes And Systems To Achieve Improved Maintenance Execution At The Naval Shipyards. The Successful Candidate Will Focus On Shipyard And Project Team Performance, Including Business Policy, Process, And Strategy Implementation. The LEAN Business Process Analyst (Senior) Will Conduct Extensive Investigations To Understand Root Cause Of Issues Across Functions And Business Elements Of Shipyard And Project Team Operations While Providing Other Direct Support To The Noblis LEAN Project Operations Manager In The Execution Of The Following LEAN Program Objectives: Planning, training, coaching, facilitating LEAN events, metric development, solution implementation, sustainment, and integration functions or activities as necessary to successfully achieve process/performance improvement objectives  Implementation of strategy and plans, including management of education and training support and initiatives  Initiative Identification and scoping of potential shipyard business improvement opportunities  Provide BCAs with particular focus on throughput, cycle time of shipyard business and industrial processes  Required Qualifications  Bachelors degree in a related filed. Additional relevant experience may be considered in lieu of a Bachelors.  10-15 years minimum experience supporting or leading process improvement initiatives, including LEAN practitioner certification (e.g. ASQ certified Black Belt)  DOD SECRET Security Clearance  Skilled in use of MS Office Suite tools and applications  Drafting and delivering presentations (to junior and senior personnel), including facilitation for small and large groups  Appropriate written and verbal communication skills to interact with U.S. Navy military and civilian personnel #seao4x Desired Qualifications  Broad naval maintenance and/or Naval Shipyards (or related field)  Familiarity with public naval shipyards operational/management structure and strategic initiatives, CNO availability planning and execution (CONUS and OCONUS), NAVSEA strategic initiatives and insertion into naval shipyards. title: Sr. Business Analyst (L6), Search Marketing
job_description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  DescriptionThe Search Marketing organization is looking for an experienced Sr. Business Analyst to lead and manage paid search program performance, reporting, planning, and analysis of the Search Marketing channel (inclusive of Paid Shopping & Text Ads, and Earned Search). You will create reporting mechanisms to understand customer behavior and deliver insights explaining business trends, and conduct deep dives into performance trends and issues throughout the funnel accessing internal and external data sources, in turn supporting our mission to scale the business globally - i.e. drive web site traffic, generate demand, and help grow our Search Marketing efforts globally.You will own performance reporting and drive business reviews. You will partner with cross-functional stakeholders, both internal and external, to launch and scale new programs. You will generate insights from large, disparate marketing performance data sets to inform marketing strategy and explain business performance.A successful candidate will be highly analytical, resourceful, customer-focused, and will have an ability to work independently under time constraints to meet deadlines. You will have a proven track record taking on end-to-end ownership and successfully delivering results in a fast-paced and dynamic business environment. At the core of the position is owning business performance, reporting, and analysis for the Global Search Marketing Organization. This requires high attention to detail and delivering high quality results on time. This is a high-visibility position with scope for creativity and self-development. You will develop a detailed understanding of digital marketing and understand the long-term financial impact of international customer behavior trends. The role requires a highly analytical mindset as well as a curiosity to seek out new possibilities to scale across traffic channels. You should be strong at and attracted to the analytical and technical side of marketing with experience with financial reporting and data visualization, as well as performance marketing competencies, thus enabling you to extract insights from disparate data sources to explain customer dynamics as well as delivering recommendations and action plans to make tactical and strategic changes to react.Key job responsibilities Lead development and improvement of performance reporting, analysis, and business reviews for the Global Search Marketing Organization Derive insights from data; Synthesize data into succinct narrative and bridges to enable business and leadership to make investment and strategy decisions Develop and automate market-segment reports to enable business team to understand impact of targeted initiatives Build cohesive full-funnel reporting and visualize, explain, and deliver narratives on how input metrics are impacting the performance of the channel Conduct analysis on marketing experiments to understand how changes are affecting the customer experience and to deliver entitlement estimations for scaled solutions Expand repository of sample analyses methods to build cross-team knowledge of common ad hoc analysis workflows Deliver action plans to react to trends in data Challenge current setup/approach, identifying new opportunities for responding to market trends based upon analysis Improve asset reporting and creative optimization reporting views to accelerate ad, extension, and organic listing optimization Act as liaison and primary Search Marketing point of contact Business to finance, BI, global partners, and leadership stakeholders, and effectively collaborate with other marketing channels to build cross-channel Write effectively to report on progress against goals and learning/insights from tests. The ideal candidate will have 5-7 years of experience owning enterprise performance marketing campaigns (Paid Search and/or Paid Social) in an analyst roleWe are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:New York City, NY, USA | Seattle, WA, USABasic Qualifications Experience in financial/business analysis 6+ years of Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables) experience Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, business, economics, engineering , analytics, mathematics, statistics or a related technical or quantitative field Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights Experience with Excel Experience with SQL Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders 5+ years experience with Search Marketing: Managing campaigns via Google Ads, Bing Ads, Pinterest.Preferred Qualifications MBAAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. title: Senior Strategy Analyst
job_description: Position Title: Senior Analyst, Strategy & Analytics​Salary: $105,000 - 115,000 +bonus (commensurate with experience)At E15, we are the spark that ignites. Our team delivers next-generation insights based on data, not hunches, to drive business in healthcare, campus, corporate, sports, entertainment, hospitality, and retail industries to help companies make forward-looking decisions to benefit their business and their guests. For more information on what we are about as a company, check us out by following the link below: www.e15group.comJob SummaryCompass Group, one of the world’s largest food service companies, has a new opportunity for the right person to join the organization and influence a Fortune 5 global tech client’s hospitality and food program. If you’re looking for a challenging, strategy-driven, innovative work environment with one of our top global clients, this role is for you! The Senior Analyst, Strategy and Analytics will report directly to the VP of Strategy and Innovation. This person will partner closely with key strategic projects to help inform future design and development of the corporate dining experience. This role requires a strategic business mindset and a bias for action. Successful candidates will thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and efficiently partner with various stakeholders, from leaders to individual contributors and support staff. Responsibilities:Synthesize quantitative data (financial, transactional, equipment costs) and qualitative information (customer feedback, space design trends) to create recommendations to inform future space needs. Build financial models that are the blueprint for global operational guidelines. Oversee the execution of pilot projects to understand impact and scalability. Collaborate with subject-matter experts from design and construction, foodservice operation, culinary, and space/experience design. Complete ad hoc analyses that provide insights and potential action items. Create an economic valuation of pilot projects’ bottom-line impact. Use syndicated databases to query, download, and analyze data on consumers, food and beverage trends, and competitive locations; create visuals to communicate complex qualitative and quantitative data related to consumer insights. Assemble actionable, relevant insights from a variety of data sources (point-of-sale data, vending data, third-party sources, etc.). Required Skills:Bachelor’s (or higher) degree in business analytics, economics, finance, statistics, or a related field Professional knowledge or experience of the following:Expertise in Excel modeling and financial business modeling are strongly preferredData visualization (Tableau or PowerBI preferred)SQL experience is a plusExperience or understanding of construction project managementAttention to detail and project managementEnthusiasm for testing new things and innovatingGreat work ethic with a strong sense of urgency to support teammates and clientsExcellent written and oral communication skillsLocation: Seattle or Washington DCTravel Expectation: 0-20% Apply to E15 today!E15 is a member of Compass Group USAClick here to Learn More about the Compass Story Compass Group is an equal opportunity employer.
